intro: Ulmus campestris var. chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese field elm, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by small, round fruits. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can tolerate urban environments. Its rapid growth and adaptability make it a common ornamental and street tree in many parts of Asia.
